alert.note: Alert for Humphreys (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued December 09 at 3:02PM CST until December 09 at 3:30PM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Central Humphreys County in Middle Tennessee... * Until 330 PM CST. * At 301 PM CST, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near New Johnsonville, or 7 miles south of Camden, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... New Johnsonville around 305 PM CST. Hurricane Mills around 315 PM CST. Waverly around 320 PM CST. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include I-40 Near The Tennessee River. This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 136 and 142. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
